messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Adventure Ideas in Phoenix Area
messages.msgSnippet: ... Be sure to go look at the photos - otherwise this might not sound as cool as it really seems to be. It is just a few minutes from the conference site.
messages.messageBody:
On 3/3/2009 8:48 PM, secondmocat wrote:
> My 12-year-old son and I are excited to be going to HENA this week. We
> are meeting friends (mom and 12-year-old son) who used to live near us
> here in CT and now live in CA. We will be staying a few days after the
> conference to explore the area. We hope to do some hiking and
> site-seeing. Any fun ideas?
>
> Mary
>
Be sure to go look at the photos - otherwise this might not sound as
cool as it really seems to be. It is just a few minutes from the
conference site.

<http://www.dbg.org/index.php/chihuly>

Chihuly: The Nature of Glass
November 22, 2008 to May 31, 2009

The Desert Botanical Garden is excited to present an exhibition by
renowned artist Dale Chihuly. /Chihuly: The Nature of Glass/ will
feature new and unique works of glass artfully located throughout the
Garden. Dale Chihuly is known for his innovative glass sculptures, and
his work is immediately recognizable for its grand scale and vibrant
colors.

Chihuly's spectacular creations are found in more than 200 museums
worldwide including the Metropolitan Museum of Art, London's Victoria
and Albert Museum and the Smithsonian American Art Museum. Garden
exhibitions of his work have been mounted at the New York Botanical
Garden, Fairchild Tropical Botanic Garden, Atlanta Botanical Garden,
Missouri Botanical Garden, Phipps Conservatory and the Royal Botanical
Gardens at Kew. This is Chihuly's first exhibition in an outdoor desert
environment.

messages.subject: Re: Adventure Ideas in Phoenix Area
messages.msgSnippet: As a former Phoenix resident, I always recommend: Hiking - Echo Canyon Park (west side of Camelback Mtn), a taste of Sedona in the center of Phoenix; Squaw
messages.messageBody:
As a former Phoenix resident, I always recommend:

Hiking - Echo Canyon Park (west side of Camelback Mtn), a taste of Sedona in the center of Phoenix; Squaw Peak, hiking as social event; and South Mountain Park (16,000 acres)

Taliesin West - Frank Lloyd Wright's architecture school, still in operation, daily tours about how Wright integrated architecture, music, and the natural environment

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Adventure Ideas in Phoenix Area
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Mary, Here are some places we like to vist - Hole in the Rock in Papago park, this is right next to the Phoenix Zoo (which is also nice).
messages.messageBody:
Hi Mary,

Here are some places we like to vist -

Hole in the Rock in Papago park, this is right next to the Phoenix Zoo
(which is also nice).
http://www.roadsideamerica.com/story/15172

It is also near the Desert Botanical Gardens - great for a hike!
http://www.dbg.org/

For indoor entertainment, we like....

Stratum Laser Tag
Maybe we are just deprived in Tucson,
but my kids (me, too!) occasionally drive 2 hrs just to play laser tag here
-
http://www.stratumhq.com/

Arizona Science Center is awesome!
http://www.azscience.org/

The Heard Museum is great.
Oh! They are having their Indian Fair & Market on March 7 & 8.
I haven't been to it before, but we have attended their Hoop Dance
Championships.
I imagine their Indian Fair would be equally fantastic!
http://www.heard.org/


Amazing Jake's - indoor entertainment & pizza/pasta/salad buffet place.
http://www.amazingjakes.com/mesa/index.php

If you are up for a drive & something different, you might like to visit
Arcosanti.
Here is an article about it.
http://www.greatescapes.com/ci_5855577?source=most_viewed
www.arcosanti.org <http://www.greatescapes.com/www.arcosanti.org>

In Phoenix, you can go check out his bells here - www.cosanti.com

Here is someone's list of best places to visit in Phoenix.
Might give you some other ideas -
http://phoenix.about.com/od/attractionsandevents/a/15bestplaces_4.htm

Have fun!

Heather M
tucson az

messages.subject: Adventure Ideas in Phoenix Area
messages.msgSnippet: My 12-year-old son and I are excited to be going to HENA this week.  We are meeting friends (mom and 12-year-old son) who used to live near us here in CT and
messages.messageBody:
My 12-year-old son and I are excited to be going to HENA this week. We
are meeting friends (mom and 12-year-old son) who used to live near us
here in CT and now live in CA. We will be staying a few days after the
conference to explore the area. We hope to do some hiking and
site-seeing. Any fun ideas?

Mary
